text: Cave makes his Soundsuits from cast-off goods and clothing scavenged from thrift stores, flea markets, auctions, and art fairs. As both fiber artist and dancer, he balances function and design—Soundsuits work as freestanding sculptures but were made to be worn. His first Soundsuit was created in the early 1990s in response to the Rodney King beating by police officers and subsequent riots in Los Angeles, California. In this context, the Soundsuits have often been described as a protective “second skin.” He has staged numerous events in which the Soundsuits become moveable sculptures that allow the wearer to subsume their own identity and to adopt that of the garment in a fusion of textile art, sculpture, and performance.
title: Soundsuit
